docs.lead_paragraph: New-Orleans papers of Thursday last have been received. The Postmaster of New-Orleans has withdrawn the objectionable portion of his card, which caused the resignation of his clerks. The Savannah and Charleston papers say the fever is assuming a more managable form.

headline.main: LETTER FROM GEO. PEABODY.; Serious Charges Against the U.S. Secretary o Legation. Another View of the Famous London Dinner.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editors of the Boston Post: My attention has been called to an agonymouse letter, dated at London, published in your paper of the 21st ult, commenting on the proceedings at a dinner, given by me, at Richmond, in celebration of the 78th anniversary of American Independence, on the 4th July; and I cannot allow
docs.abstract: His conduct at the Peabody dinner

docs.lead_paragraph: A stated meeting of the Board of Education was held yesterday at 5 o'clock P. M., at the Hal of the Board, ERASTUS C. BENEDICT, Esq., in the Chair. ALFRED GILBERT officiated as Secretary. The minutes of the last meeting were read and approved.

docs.lead_paragraph: If the superintendent of the weather in good faith offered the premium of a rousing thunder storm to the day of all the year that should prove the hottest, the 6th of September should have gone out with a terrible squall. The thermometer is an untrusty judge in such matters. t tells only

headline.main: LETTERS ON THE CHARITIES OF ENGLAND.; A NIGHT'S VISIT. NUMBER THREE. THE LONDON LODGING-HOUSES

docs.lead_paragraph: A very polite and flexible person, who seemed to have entered almost without our hearing him, introduced himself to us as Mr. Inspector P--, of the Police, "and should be 'apply to show us over the licensed and unregistered lodgin'-'ouses, us Captain H-- had ordered."

headline.main: FOREIGN MISCELLANY.; FROM OUR LATEST FOREIGN FILES.

OUR STATE PRISONS.; How Some Fresh Affidavits Look Side by Side. Cross-Examination of Some of Brigadier--General Lockwood's Witnesses. Management and Mismanagement of the Sing Sing Prison. INQUIRY INTO THE "NATURE OF THE BEAST."

docs.lead_paragraph: As I have heretofore mentioned, there appeared in the Westchester Herald, (one of our local papers,) of the 29th ult., a communication from MUNSON I. LOCKWOOD, Agent of the Sing Sing Prison, which I bog of you to publish entire, if for no other purpose but to show the "well of English undefiled," in which the Prison officials dip their buckets. Here it is:
